@saifedean Greg Maxwell definitely thinks CT is workable,which is why it’s in Elements & Grin. Additionally, Monero’s privacy enhancements existed from the outset, RingCT (which improves on CT) was only added in Jan 2017. Please stop embarrassing yourself by commenting on technical aspects.

After a day of angry responses, nobody has refuted my point that nobody should use Monero for anything privacy critical.   Skin in the game: Are Monero's promoters willing to be held liable for damage happening to users from broken privacy?  If not, why is it ok to promote it?

If you believed the Monero marketing & bought drugs with it, you should delete your transaction from the blockchain before it's identified.  Oh wait, you can't!  THAT is why you don't use a global immutable ledger for your drug habit.  Just buy off the street like normal junkies.

@FedericoTenga @hashfunk @saifedean Monero's working on making that a practical reality: Lightning + TumbleBit (on both ends of the atomic Lightning path) should provide maximal privacy, as long as you're settling back to a chain that supports CT (such as Monero's).

Monero forking would have disastrous consequences for privacy. Sacrificing it for a dubious war with miners when it's the main selling point of the coin shows a poor sense of priority from its leadership.
I just market bought more Monero because YOLO (I'm dumb this isn't financial advice.)

Good on Monero for warning people not to spend on forks b/c it destroys their privacy. Problem is in Monero other people spending on a fork also destroys your privacy. And those people probably don't care about their or your privacy, they just want to moon.
